item.title: Simple movement code but brainteaser kind of thing
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

onClipEvent (load) {
    walkSpeed = 5;
}

onClipEvent (enterFrame) {
    if (Key.isDown(Key.UP)) {
        _y -= walkSpeed;
    }
}

onClipEvent (enterFrame) {
    if (Key.isDown(Key.DOWN)) {
        _y += walkSpeed;
    }
}

onClipEvent (enterFrame) {
    if (Key.isDown(Key.RIGHT)) {
        _x += walkSpeed;
    }
}

onClipEvent (enterFrame) {
    if (Key.isDown(Key.LEFT)) {
        _x -= walkSpeed;
    }
}

Although the code is horrible, and done so improperly, I believe ^this^ is what you were looking for.

walkSpeed = 5;

}
onClipEvent (enterFrame) {
if (Key.isDown(Key.UP)) {
_y-= walkSpeed;
}
}
onClipEvent (enterFrame) {
if (Key.isDown(Key.RIGHT)) {
_x+= walkSpeed;
}
}
[/code]
that is the code for UP and Right so with those two bits of code you should be able to work out how to make your object go left and down
